instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates low-frequency oscillators
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

giSine ftgen 1, 0, 16384, 10, 1
giSaw ftgen 2, 0, 16384, 10, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.25, 0.2

instr 1
    ; lfo opcode: kres lfo kamp, kcps [, itype]
    ; lfo generates low frequency oscillation
    ; kamp - amplitude
    ; kcps - frequency in Hz
    ; itype - waveform type (0=sine, 1=triangle, 2=square up, 3=square down, 4=saw up, 5=saw down)
    
    iAmp = 0.5
    iFreq = 440
    
    ; Sine LFO for amplitude modulation
    kLFO lfo 0.3, 5, 0
    kAmp = 0.2 + kLFO
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, iFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 2
    ; Triangle LFO
    iAmp = 0.5
    iFreq = 440
    
    kLFO lfo 0.3, 4, 1
    kAmp = 0.2 + kLFO
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, iFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 3
    ; Square wave LFO for tremolo
    iAmp = 0.5
    iFreq = 440
    
    kLFO lfo 0.25, 6, 2
    kAmp = 0.25 + kLFO
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, iFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 4
    ; lfsr opcode: ares lfsr kreg, imask, ishift
    ; lfsr generates pseudo-random sequences using linear feedback shift register
    ; kreg - register value
    ; imask - bit mask
    ; ishift - shift amount
    
    ; Note: lfsr is typically used for modulation
    ; Demonstration with basic noise-like modulation
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = 440
    
    ; Random modulation
    kRand randh 50, 10
    kFreq = iFreq + kRand
    
    aOsc poscil iAmp, kFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 5
    ; LFO on filter cutoff
    iAmp = 0.5
    iFreq = 220
    
    aSource poscil iAmp, iFreq, giSaw
    
    ; LFO controls filter
    kLFO lfo 2000, 0.5, 0
    kCutoff = 800 + kLFO
    
    aFilt butterlp aSource, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 6
    ; Multiple LFOs
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = 330
    
    ; LFO 1: amplitude
    kLFO1 lfo 0.2, 4, 0
    kAmp = 0.3 + kLFO1
    
    ; LFO 2: frequency (vibrato)
    kLFO2 lfo 10, 5.5, 0
    kFreq = iFreq + kLFO2
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, kFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play sine LFO
i1 0 3

; Play triangle LFO
i2 4 3

; Play square LFO
i3 8 3

; Play random modulation
i4 12 3

; Play filter LFO
i5 16 4

; Play multiple LFOs
i6 21 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>
